snippet: Guest blogger Mike Abramowitz argues that the Responsibility to Protect, which urges outside intervention to stop mass killing, is in danger of becoming nothing more than a platitude.
abstract: Guest blogger Mike Abramowitz argues that the Responsibility to Protect, which urges outside intervention to stop mass killing, is in danger of becoming nothing more than a platitude.

headline.main: Who Will Stand Up for the Responsibility to Protect?
